name: Preliminary and General - Traffic Management Plan
Standard / Specification: TDC Approved TM Plan
Preliminary and General - Safe Work Method Statement
Frequency: Prior to start of work
Acceptance Criteria: Ensure all materials compliance and preconstruction documents are reviewed prior to construction
Verifying Records: Copies of all compliance certificates
Preliminary and General - Service Plans & Locate
Acceptance Criteria: Marked on site & service plans kept on site. Water, Storm Water, Waste Water, Telecommunications & Power.
Frequency: Prior to start of work
Preliminary and General - Notify Local Iwi
Acceptance Criteria: Notify Local Iwi to determine whether or not works are in high sensitivity area and require cultural monitor
Frequency: Prior to start of work
Preliminary and General - Accidental Discovery of archaeological matter NB: Applicable only when discovery are made during construction activities
Acceptance Criteria: Construction supervisor advised by operator
• All work within 100m of the site ceased immediately
• Site secured to ensure archaeological matter remains undisturbed
• Client Rep/Engineer informed by construction Manager"
Preliminary and General - Permit - To Dig
Acceptance Criteria: Produce & Handover permit to dig to foreman & crew.

Acceptance Criteria: The minimum trench width shall be 300 mm wider than the external diameter of the collar of the pipe being laid, providing the haunching metal is compacted under and at the sides of the pipe.
Acceptance Criteria: Base of Excavation to be levelled and undisturbed
• 50 KPa ≤ 70 mm / blow – no soft raft required
• install ‘softground’ (SD344/3) construct on a layer of 50 KPa
• Less than 35 KPa - >100 mm/blow – speak to the designer  "
Acceptance Criteria: In accordance with SD344
Standard / Specification: In Accordance with TDC Spec
Stormwater Drainage - Pipe Line and Level
Acceptance Criteria: TNZ F/3 Minimum 1 in 80 = 1.25%
Standard / Specification: TNZ F/3: Pipe culvert construction
Acceptance Criteria: Shall be as specified in the CSS Part 4; 750 mm with a minimum grade specified depending on the pipe diameter from Transit Highway Surface Drainage Guide.
Test: Proof Rolling - Wheel Roller min loading 6259kg /metre width of fill
Verifying Records: Proof Rolling - Wheel Roller min loading 6259kg /metre width of fill
Frequency: Each layer of fill placed
Acceptance Criteria: Subbase - mean greater than or equal to 95% and no results below 92%
Test: NDM – maximum dry density MDD
Pavement - Basecourse construction – compaction TNZ B/2
Acceptance Criteria: Basecourse – mean greater than or equal to 98% and no result below 95%
Test: NDM – maximum dry density MDD
Frequency: 5 tests per homogenous  lot of up to 1000m2 of laid pavement TNZ B/2:2005 Construction unbound granular pavement layers
Standard / Specification: TNZ B/2:2005 Construction unbound granular pavement layers
Pavement - Subbase/ Basecourse (including cement treated) construction – deflection
Acceptance Criteria: Subbase - a minimum 95th percentile deflection of D0 = 1.7mm and D600 = 0.7mm
• Basecourse - a minimum 95th percentile deflection of D0 = 1.2mm and D600 = 0.6mm
Test: Benkelman beam or falling weight deflectometer
Verifying Records: Benkleman Beam Test Results
Frequency: Each lane inner and outer wheel tracks every 10m TNZ T/1 Benkleman Beam Deflection Measurements
Standard / Specification: TNZ T/1 Benkleman Beam Deflection Measurements
Acceptance Criteria: Sawcut edges in permanent surfaces
Standard / Specification: SNZ HB 2002:2003 Code of Practise for Working in the Road
Surfacing - Preparation for sealing / surfacing - Check list App 2
Acceptance Criteria: Site Surface inspection By Client/Consultant
Acceptance Criteria: Compaction commenced as soon as the asphalt has cooled sufficiently to support rollers weight without undue displacement.
• Compaction using vibratory roller and pneumatic tyred roller
• NZTA Core Samples: 150 mm nominal dia except where total asphalt layer thickness falls below 40 mm sample can be 100 mm"
Acceptance Criteria: Non-structural component of the pavement: the specified layer thickness shall not be less than the average measured thickness of each lot.

• Structural component: the average thickness of any individual layer in a lot shall be not less than the specified thickness by more than 10% and the total thickness of any core not more than 5 mm less than that specified.
• NB: Where confirmation of asphalt thickness is required, it shall be determined by coring to a recognised random sampling plan.
Acceptance Criteria: The site shall be clean and tidy on completion of work with all surplus material removed
Test: At practical completion of works
Verifying Records: At practical completion of works
Acceptance Criteria: Walk over with Project Coordinator
Test: Signed off by Project Coordinator
Verifying Records: Signed off by Project Coordinator
Frequency: At practical completion of works
